sentences.chinese: 他们明目张胆地篡改马克思主义。

sentences.english: Many laminated documents are waterproof, tear proof, and tamper proof.
sentences.chinese: 许多夹层文件防水，抗撕裂证明，和防篡改。

sentences.english: Similarly, one can tamper with the actual response from a legitimate query.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，可以篡改来自合法查询的实际响应。

sentences.english: You want to verify that the message coming to the recipient hasn't been tampered with.
sentences.chinese: 您希望验证发送到接收者的消息还没有被篡改。

sentences.english: If tampers with the manuscript to originate arbitrarily, this net will hold responsible legally.
sentences.chinese: 如擅自篡改稿件来源，本网将依法追究责任。
这篇文章已被篡改过了。

sentences.english: Democrats were accused of fiddling with state law for partisan advantage.
sentences.chinese: 民主党被指篡改州法律为本党谋私。

sentences.english: The lid is an aluminium-covered cork bung, over-covered with a tamper-evident shrink wrap.
sentences.chinese: 盖子是铝覆盖软木邦，过覆盖篡改明显收缩包装。

sentences.english: Encrypt or tamper-proof saved data for a game.
sentences.chinese: 加密或防篡改保存游戏数据。

sentences.english: It was said that his personal records were rejiggered by one of his schoolmates.
sentences.chinese: 据说他的个人档案被他的一个同学篡改过。

sentences.english: All messages in transit should be protected from tampering by untrusted intermediaries.
sentences.chinese: 应该防止传输中的所有消息受到不可靠中介的篡改。

sentences.english: For branded items, please ensure that the serial numbers have not been manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 对于名牌商品，请确保该系列号没有被篡改。

sentences.english: The treasurer was arrested for trying to manipulate the company's accounts.
sentences.chinese: 这个会计因企图篡改公司账目而被捕。

sentences.english: Someone has tampered with the accounts of the company.
sentences.chinese: 有人篡改了公司的账目。

sentences.english: Sealing also provides a security measure to detect code tampering.
sentences.chinese: 密封还提供了防止代码篡改的手段。

sentences.english: Tampering involves someone intercepting a message and then changing it.
sentences.chinese: 篡改包括某人拦截一条消息并更改它。

definition: to embezzle/to defraud/to use illegitimately/to misappropriate
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to alter (text)/to change by painting over/to correct (with correction fluid)
